name: confirmatory
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
proving or stating that something is correct, especially a medical diagnosis (= judgment about what an illness or problem is) or test result: Anyone who tests positive with a rapid test must get a confirmatory blood test.
More examplesFewer examplesBlood units that initially test positive must undergo confirmatory tests to be sure the virus is present.An MRI scan may be given for women at high risk of breast cancer or needing a confirmatory diagnosis.The diagnosis of osteoarthritis is not difficult, even without an x-ray, although an x-ray may be confirmatory.The patients all had some other confirmatory evidence of active gut inflammation.
